sen.j: 充行状（おておこないじょう/あてがいじょう）とは、中世に見られる文章形式。
sen.e: Ate okonai jo (or Ote okonai jo) was a style of document that was used in the medieval period.
Ate okonai jo (or Ote okonai jo) was a style of document used during the medieval period.
Ate okonai jo (also Ote okonai jo or ategai jo) was a style of document used during the medieval period.

sen.j: 文面に「充行」の二字が入っていることに由来する。
sen.e: This term derived from the fact that two chinese characters "充行" were included in the sentence.
The term is derived from the fact that the two Chinese characters "充行" (ate okonai) are included in the text.
sen.cmt: changed "sentence" to "text"; added (ate okonai); fixed grammar
sen.e: The term is derived from the fact that the two Chinese characters "充行" (ate okonai) are included in the text.

sen.j: 中世武家社会において荘園などを分譲する際の文章で用いられる。
sen.e: This style was used for ducuments proving the transfer of shoen etc. in the samurai world of medieval period.
This style of document was used in samurai society during the medieval period as a proof of transfer for belongings, such as a shoen (manor).
sen.cmt: changed "etc." to "such as"; added description for shoen; fixed grammar; added "belongings"
sen.e: This style of document was used in samurai society during the medieval period as a proof of transfer for belongings, such as a shoen (manor).

sen.j: また、武家が家臣に知行を給与する際にも用いられる。
sen.e: It was also used when samurai entitled their vassals to chigyo (the right to manage the territory).
It was also used when samurai entitled their vassals to chigyo (the right to manage a territory).
It was also used when samurai entitled their vassals to chigyo (the right to manage a territory).

sen.j: 中世の公文書、私文書ともにこの形式を採用している。
sen.e: Both official documents and private documents in the medieval period adopted this style.
Both official and private documents adopted the style of Ate okonai jo during in the medieval period.
sen.cmt: eliminated one "documents"; changed "this style" to "the style of Ate okonai jo"; changed "in" to "during"
sen.e: Both official and private documents adopted the style of Ate okonai jo during in the medieval period.
